@jaredctate If 75% of LTC hashrate disappears, Litecoin will be as slow as Bitcoin (10 mins blocks) for 2 weeks. No big deal. And that's not going to happen to Litecoin unlike smaller coins where hashrate will disappear to mine other coins due to price fluctuations.

A huge part of this is because #Bitcoin & #Litecoin stil take two weeks for difficulty adjustments to occur. And when they happen, the increase & or decrease is limited. So it takes multiple intervals. You don't need as much hash to launch attacks. $DGB diff responds in real-time
